It is on this day in 1969 we remember the heroic act of Airman First Class John L. Levitow, who risked his life in order to save his fellow comrades. As he was aboard a night mission during the Vietnam War, Sgt. Levitow‚Äôs aircraft was struck by a round of explosives. In order to combat the attack, members aboard the aircraft began launching activated flares to be able to see the enemy and prepare ground troops for attack. However, due to the enemy attack‚Äîa member on board the aircraft dropped one of these magnesium flares. Even though Sgt. Levitow was severely wounded from the explosion, he made a split second decision to throw himself on the flare in order to protect others if it were to detonate. Thankfully, he was able to throw it outside of the aircraft right before it was activated. Through this action he demonstrated true American courage and became one of only two enlisted airmen to win the Medal of Honor. It is on this day we remember him‚Äîand all of those in our armed forces who make the ultimate sacrifices so that we can live free.
